title: List of all Android alarmmanager  libraries for use in your project
meta: See collection of all Android alarmmanager  libraries, filter by license, modified date, languages, and select best for your usecase.

repoList.name: JobSchedulerCompat
repoList.description: Android library to schedule background jobs using JobScheduler, GCMNetworkManager or AlarmManager, depending on the context.

repoList.name: AlarmManager
repoList.description: A simple library written in Kotlin that allows you to set an alarm and get notified really easily.

repoList.name: react-native-alarms
repoList.description: ⏰React Native library for interacting with Android alarms.

repoList.name: Alarm-Library
repoList.description: 对Android 闹铃功能的封装，方便进行闹铃的设置及其他操作 - AlarmManager

repoList.name: Background_service
repoList.description: Android library for starting background-service and receiving a broadcast after the time is out. The library will automatically start the service in background and foreground depending on the time that you provide.

repoList.name: alarm-manager-simplify
repoList.description: Alarm Manager Simplify is a code generation library to simplify the code for AlarmManager on Android.

repoList.name: News-and-weather-app-for-android
repoList.description: Provides latest news and weather forecast from the web-services (newsapi.org and openweathermap.org) by location. Network connection guaranteed by using of Volley library. Also, the app notifies the user about information updatings (Service & AlarmManager).

repoList.name: alt-beacon-alarm-manager
repoList.description: A major problem when you're working with beacons is the Android Oreo and Pie services limitation, thus to remedy these shortcomings, this projects uses AlarmManagers + Services + Broadcastes with AltBeacon library for beacon background detection without the weird fixed notification.

repoList.name: MoEngage-News
repoList.description: Sample app to demonstrate offline feature using pure Java, Repository pattern, SQLite, ViewModel and DataBinding. Without using any third party libraries.
